list.content: We have theater, books, movies, all kinds of art, and all genres of music, we developed AR and VR, built all kinds of immersive games and experiences on top of it. But despite all of this, we cannot even start to understand how someone else sees the world unless we have been in their shoes.
So much changes in so little time while it feels like nothing changes overall.
People don't like Matrix sequels, but I disagree. They have some amazing moments and they do an amazing job of turning the trope of "hero's journey" on its head.
So many expect someone else to love them before they love themselves.
If you have to choose between bird-man and man-bird, always choose bird-man.
Pencils used to be a regular part of my life. Now it's incredibly rare that I use one for anything other than signing my name.
Turns out, not everyone wants to be able to fly...
I wholeheartedly want James Webb Space Telescope to successfully deploy and show us all the amazing things we cannot yet see
